pr_title: Avoid WARNING: Illegal reflective access by datadog.trace.instrumentation.java.concurrent.NewTaskFor

timeline.message:
Merge NewTaskFor with WrapRunnableAsNewTaskInstrumentation by using a placeholder 'newTaskFor' call.
The placeholder call in the advice will be rewritten to call the real 'newTaskFor' at build time.

Note: once the 'NewTaskFor' advice has been rewritten it can only be applied to executors that extend
AbstractExecutorService otherwise we get class verification errors at load time. For other executors
we apply a simpler wrapper that avoids 'newTaskFor'. This results in a bit of duplication but that's
tolerated as it means we can avoid having to inject helpers onto the bootclasspath.

timeline.bodyText: You probably don't need this at all if you get rid of the netty executors which don't extend AbstractExecutorService i.e. the executor groups. They always delegate anyway, so everything should work fine.
timeline.author: richardstartin

replies.bodyText:
I assume it's also safe to remove:
java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$ThreadPerTaskExecutor
java.util.concurrent.SubmissionPublisher$ThreadPerTaskExecutor

since they don't extend AbstractExecutorService, they just call new Thread(task)
replies.author: mcculls

replies.bodyText: actually I guess those will need to stay, because they don't end up delegating to AbstractExecutorService
replies.author: mcculls

replies.bodyText: We only need java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$ThreadPerTaskExecutor because we have an isolated test for it - we should rely on the CompletableFuture instrumentation instead. I'm not that familiar with java.util.concurrent.SubmissionPublisher$ThreadPerTaskExecutor - so it may be the justification for this extra instrumentation.
replies.author: richardstartin

replies.bodyText:
For future reference after this PR is merged: We should not be instrumenting either of these executors.

java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$ThreadPerTaskExecutor should defer to the CompletableFuture instrumentation
java.util.concurrent.SubmissionPublisher$ThreadPerTaskExecutor should defer to a new java.util.concurrent.SubmissionPublisher$ConsumerTask instrumentation which would track the ConsumerTasks lifecycle.
replies.author: richardstartin
